intro: Eschscholzia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and a distinctive, saucer-shaped flower. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stem is erect and often branched. Eschscholzia mexicana is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppies.
